document_data.name: Ornabra
document_data.mainbody: '''Ornabra''' was a specialty [[stew]] dish served at the ramshackle [[Owlroost Head Inn]] of the [[Amn]]ian town of [[Purskul]] as of the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Description: Ornabra was a type of stew prepared with [[potato]]es, [[beef]], and [[goat]] meat. When sold to be taken out of the dining hall, it was drained and wrapped in a [[shield]]-sized [[flatbread]]. The dish slowly oozed its thick juices and could be eaten on the go.
document_data.History: As of the late 14{{th}} century DR, ornabra was a cheaper offering of the Owlroost Head Inn. It was popular among traveling caravaners.
